RT @PendleIntern: Symbiotic x Mellow x Pendle YTs 🍡

Projected ROI = 113%-145%
Projected APR = 1538%-1961%

Before you ape in with no regards, please understand that these numbers were conceived between an intense gym session and lunch on an empty stomach.

In other words, there is no world where these should ever be construed as financial advice.

Lots of assumptions were made, so please DYOR and take the time to understand them 👇🏻

@symbioticfi Point

• Symbiotic Points are NOT being accrued by YTs at the moment, not until a cap increase by Symbiotic is able to accommodate them. For now, assumption is that you'll only be getting Symbiotic points for ~50% of the days (from now until maturity)

• Current points are derived based on Daily TVL record from @DefiLlama, multiplied by the base rate of Symbiotic Points (0.00025 point/day per $)

• Daily Points Growth have a 10x multiplier, meaning the number shown here is 10x more than the current estimated rate. In other words, numbers are more conservative.

• FDV of $10B assumed + 5% airdrop allocation + snapshot on 30 Sep 2024

@mellowprotocol Points

• Mellow LRTs are earning 3x boosted rate at the moment on @pendle_fi. Once SYMBIOTIC caps are lifted, this reverts to 2x boosted rate (for Pendle only). Assumption here is that you'll get the boosted 3x rate for 50% of the days only.

• Daily Points Growth also have a 10x multiplier, meaning the number shown here is 10x more than the current estimated rate. In other words, numbers are more conservative.

• FDV of $750M assumed + 5% airdrop allocation + snapshot on 30 Sep 2024

Remember - Mellow YTs have no yield and are points only. ROI is estimated based on these assumptions and numbers, which may or may not be correct. How much are points worth? Are they enough to recover your YT costs? No one knows for sure, please DYOR and of course, NFA 🫡

Status on MiCA regulation 🇪🇺

MiCA (effective June 30th) does not impact Angle users.

Angle is a fully decentralized protocol meaning EURA, stEUR, USDA and stUSD are exempt from the new regulations.

MiCA 2, planned for 2025-2026, is expected to clarify DeFi regulation, including for Angle Protocol.

GMX V2.1 is now live on both @Arbitrum and @Avax! This update introduces numerous UX optimisations:

🔸 Easier integration with lending protocols

🔸 Improved transaction execution speed and reduced fees

🔸 New timestamp-based price oracle feeds, improving reliability by no longer depending on RPCs

🔸 Implementation of a kink model for borrowing rates, which will improve rates for traders

🔸 Introduction of a new ExchangeRouter.createShift function, which enables the instant withdrawal of liquidity from one GM market and deposit into another with zero deposit and withdrawal fees

🔸 and more...

Thanks to these new functionalities, GMX V2.1 can enable a range of new vaults and added-value DeFi products by GMX and its many integrators.

Additionally, the ExchangeRouter functions have been updated to include an autoCancel parameter. This allows for automatic cancellation of conditional orders such as stop-losses and take-profits once their associated position is closed.

Lastly, callback contracts can now implement a refundExecutionFee function for custom gas refund logic.

The above list is not exhaustive. For a detailed list of all the contract changes and the updated deployment addresses, visit the Github page: https://t.co/c9O988rG8r

Please keep in mind that the previously deployed contracts will remain usable for approximately two weeks, after which they will be disabled on 15 July 2024.

Struggling to manage your position and make dinner?

Not any more! Use ez CLMs while you prepare tonights ez Key West Flank Steak dinner🍴

Ingredients:
- 1 red onion, sliced
- 1 cup cilantro, minced
- 1/4 cup vinegar
- 1/4 cup lime juice
- 3 tbsp olive oil
- 6 Key limes, halved
- 1 lb beef flank steak
- Salt, pepper

Directions:
1. Mix onion, cilantro, vinegar, lime juice, and 2 tbsp oil.
2. Marinate steak. Add limes, salt, pepper for 8 hours. Keep some marinade for basting.
3. Grill steak until desired doneness, (135°F, 57°C) basting with reserved marinade.
4. Slice against the grain.
5. Serve to AI girlfriend.

RT @NickPullmanEsq: You may not agree with the take, but this a useful explanation for why you might be feeling how you’re feeling about the ruling
You may not agree with the take, but this a useful explanation for why you might be feeling how you’re feeling about the ruling

Chevron, Power Redistribution, and Legislating From the Bench

Overturning Chevron is good in that it detracts from regulatory power, but power is a zero-sum game, where did it just redirect to? The judiciary.

Even more authority has now been handed to judges. Judges are effectively despots, who can do nearly whatever they want in that small room where they're basically kings.

The interpretation of the law is what they say it is. The same conflict can have two completely different rulings depending on who's wearing the robes that day.

The judge's politics guide the interpretation of laws; this is part of the human condition. It doesn't matter where you went to school, your moral foundations will always be expressed in interpretive political analysis. If it's legal, it's inherently political; which is to say no matter what the judge says, her moral beliefs are seeping through into her decisions.

Originalism (conservative jurists) is almost pure authority/subversion moral foundation adherence. You defer to the authority of those who made the law based on their intentions, not yours, when applying it.

"The living constitution" (judicial legislation, liberal jurists) is pure fairness/cheating and care/harm. The law is whatever you think is most fair. You probably personally agree with most of your rulings when this is your north star. It's a very enticing mode of legal analysis for this reason.

A sign of a good jurist is hating some of your decisions on a personal level. Scalia taught me this. You should hate some of your rulings, following the law should not always be personally rewarding.

WHY THE JUDGE MATTERS

Judiciary power and how deeply interpretative it is, is something of an unsolvable problem. It's why you see judge shopping.

Example: an obscure judge in Hawaii blocked Trump's immigration orders while in office. Something the president campaigned on and was democratically elected to implement. One little tyrant said "no, I don't see it that way."

Why'd they take the case to Hawaii? Is it because the law is better understood by the beach? Or because they knew a hyper liberal judge will rule how the state wanted so they said "Aloha"?

Originalism is the only real legal analysis because it best attempts to separate the judges feelings from what the law dictates. Everything else is legislating from the bench. I'd be fearful of even more judge shopping as a means for the state to still get what it wants with Chevron gone.

Judges matter, a lot. The only reason I sort of care about the presidency is because of the judicial appointees he gets to make. Because the judiciary exerts actual power over the people. The president is otherwise mostly a totem.

A Lens into RabbitX: Infrastructure, Diagnosing an Issue, and Shipping a Fix

We recently had a large trader complain of latency issues. Some market orders were executing with several-second delays. We opened an internal review.

Here's what we found, and how we fixed it:

THE PROBLEM

While overall volume has remained steady, we've seen occasional large bursts of orders being submitted in close succession. This sometimes exceeds over 6,000 requests/sec (we have some market makers and HFT funds who use rapid-fire algo trading, we're built for both retail and institutions).

We've seen volume spikes as high as 15k request/sec over the last month. These surges were creating sporadic bottlenecks, resulting in small delays.

THE DIAGNOSES

Our real-time risk engine checks account margin, open positions, and equity at the account and exchange lever after each order and withdrawal placed on RabbitX. We call this Real-Time Proof of Solvency (RTPOS).

Every order must be margin compliant at the account level, and RabbitX must be solvency compliant on the exchange level, or the order won't execute.

RabbitX grew substantially in unique trading addresses from the @BlastFutures expansion (March 2024). RTPOS means we simulate margin and solvency for every single trade, open order, and all open positions for both BFX and RBX now.

More traders, no matter how big or small, means more discrete checks happening. Which means more stress on our infrastructure.

With all of these increases, we only heard complaints from one user that some of his market orders were a little slow.

Pretty good. But not good enough.

THE FIX

Our RTPOS adheres to the ACID framework (atomicity, consistency, isolation, durability). This way, every transaction can be checked hypothetically and rejected in a single atomic operation if it violates account margin OR exchange solvency. This is the security and protection you get on RabbitX. Milady.

As the number of traders and orders grew, this check started to create latency issues. Security and risk are paramount to everything built on RabbitX. But our traders also demand nothing short of lightspeed execution.

Our high-performance matching engine is built using Tarantool, an in-memory database with an expressive programming language called Lua.

To address this latency issue when trading volume spikes, we brought on more computing resources and optimized how these checks are sequenced and performed to make sure we never fall below both our performance standards AND our risk standards.

We tested it, and released it. So far, so good. But if the issue pops up again, we'll be back in the lab to fix it.

Trade. Earn. Win. RabbitX.

Back the Bunny 🐇

On RabbitX Risk Management: Real-Time Proof of Solvency (RTPOS)

We’d like to break down what’s happening under the hood of the fastest-growing (and fastest) DEX in DeFi.

Risk management is, and always will be, one of the key pillars of RabbitX. Our unwavering, autistic dedication to security and solvency works to ensure the safety of all our traders and our DEX. You’re only as strong as your weakest link.

TL;DR, we are always solvent. We accomplish this via our RTPOS risk engine, and we’d like to explain how it works. Especially as it relates to PnL and unrealized profit manipulation.

Derivatives and leverage introduce layers of complexity. To ensure solvency with every single trade AND withdrawal, RabbitX adheres to a strict monitoring of all traders’ positions, equity, PnL, and order margin.

This is what we mean by RTPOS: we check for all of this (margin compliance + exchange solvency) on every. single. order.

WHAT HAPPENS WHEN RABBITX TRADERS PLACE A TRADE:

Every time an action is effected (this means both for trades AND withdrawals) we run a risk check that looks at:

- The trader’s margin requirements to make sure they can make the trade/withdrawal (account-level check).

- All traders’ total equity across the entire exchange (including unrealized PnL). We make sure this always lines up 1:1 with deposited collateral (exchange-level check).

This is all done at once, atomically, in less than 0.001 seconds. We can support thousands of trades per second this way. How do we accomplish this?

Our RTPOS adheres to the ACID framework (atomicity, consistency, isolation, durability). Each order (and withdrawal) on RabbitX is simulated before it's confirmed.

This way, every transaction can be checked hypothetically and rejected in a single atomic operation if it violates account margin OR exchange solvency. This is RTPOS and the security and protections you get on RabbitX.

Our high-performance matching engine is built using Tarantool, an in-memory database with an expressive programming language called Lua. Tarantool is what we used to create a blazing-fast, ultra-precise exchange that’s robust enough to handle leveraged positions with billions of volume. Written in C, we recognized early on that Tarantool was the right database to build the system architecture of RabbitX.

With this model, we’re able to total all traders equity, PnL, and account margin at once atomically. This is how we ensure that the exchange’s assets are always greater than or equal to trader’s equity in real-time. Every single order. And every single withdrawal.

We are the fastest-growing DEX in DeFi, and it’s this attention to detail that matters on our way to becoming the biggest in DeFi, and then…. who knows :)

Our risk engine is the fortress that protects traders. It audits everything in real-time with ultra-low latency. A good exchange should operate a little paranoid, always concerned about its risk parameters and protections.

When it comes to risk, we are paranoid. We’ve set up the exchange to survive and manage all the swoons and crashes that go along with market cycles. Because eventually the tide always goes out, and then who’s been left skinny dipping is exposed. We always have our swimsuits on 🐰

On RabbitX your assets are always onchain, with 24/7 RTPOS checks happening constantly. No rehypothecation or comingling of customer and treasury funds.

Trade size with confidence on the Bunny

Trade. Earn. Win. RabbitX.

RT @rabbitx_io: A Lens into RabbitX: Infrastructure, Diagnosing an Issue, and Shipping a Fix

We recently had a large trader complain of latency issues. Some market orders were executing with several-second delays. We opened an internal review.

Here's what we found, and how we fixed it:

THE PROBLEM

While overall volume has remained steady, we've seen occasional large bursts of orders being submitted in close succession. This sometimes exceeds over 6,000 requests/sec (we have some market makers and HFT funds who use rapid-fire algo trading, we're built for both retail and institutions).

We've seen volume spikes as high as 15k request/sec over the last month. These surges were creating sporadic bottlenecks, resulting in small delays.

THE DIAGNOSES

Our real-time risk engine checks account margin, open positions, and equity at the account and exchange lever after each order and withdrawal placed on RabbitX. We call this Real-Time Proof of Solvency (RTPOS).

Every order must be margin compliant at the account level, and RabbitX must be solvency compliant on the exchange level, or the order won't execute.

RabbitX grew substantially in unique trading addresses from the @BlastFutures expansion (March 2024). RTPOS means we simulate margin and solvency for every single trade, open order, and all open positions for both BFX and RBX now.

More traders, no matter how big or small, means more discrete checks happening. Which means more stress on our infrastructure.

With all of these increases, we only heard complaints from one user that some of his market orders were a little slow.

Pretty good. But not good enough.

THE FIX

Our RTPOS adheres to the ACID framework (atomicity, consistency, isolation, durability). This way, every transaction can be checked hypothetically and rejected in a single atomic operation if it violates account margin OR exchange solvency. This is the security and protection you get on RabbitX. Milady.

As the number of traders and orders grew, this check started to create latency issues. Security and risk are paramount to everything built on RabbitX. But our traders also demand nothing short of lightspeed execution.

Our high-performance matching engine is built using Tarantool, an in-memory database with an expressive programming language called Lua.

To address this latency issue when trading volume spikes, we brought on more computing resources and optimized how these checks are sequenced and performed to make sure we never fall below both our performance standards AND our risk standards.

We tested it, and released it. So far, so good. But if the issue pops up again, we'll be back in the lab to fix it.

Trade. Earn. Win. RabbitX.

Back the Bunny 🐇

RT @SingularityNET: Artificial Superintelligence Alliance Business Summit and Super Launch Party Recap

The Antalya DigiExpo grounds opened up today for the first Business Summit co-hosted by the @ASI_Alliance  and DigiCEX @Digiversede.

The Summit kicked off with an opening ceremony and a welcome address by Master of Ceremonies, Bill Inman, Mistress of Ceremonies, @RealSophiaRobot, alongside her sister @DesdemonaRobot, followed by an interactive session on Superintelligence led by Sophia and her digital twin.

The #ASI Show featured a panel discussion with the CEO of SingularityNET, Dr. @bengoertzel, the CEO of @Fetch_ai, Humayun Sheikh @HMsheikh4, and ASI Growth Product Manager, Andrea Armanni (@oceanprotocol), exploring how decentralized #AI can compete with Big Tech centralized entities to create a benevolent Superintelligence.

Following this eye-opening discussion, the Summit delved into the next evolution in computing. During his presentation, the CEO of @Hypercycle_AI, Toufi Saliba @toouufii, spoke about scalable infrastructure for Superintelligence and innovation, creativity, and commercialization in the exciting world of ASI compute and the rapid rise of AI to AI transactions. The CTO of #SingularityNET, Sergey Shalyapin, then discussed the creation of supercompute hubs for decentralized processing networks. Finally, Kabir Veitas @vveitas and Ilija Radeljić from @nunet_global explored the decentralized compute network revolution.

A conversation with Dr. Ben Goertzel provided insights into his latest book, "The Consciousness Explosion," https://t.co/PBcIVjpvIn which explores the profound implications of the Technological Singularity on humanity. Funding for AI and AGI projects was a key topic, with sessions on equity funding led by the Founder of SingularityNET partner Yunity, Ani Chahal Honan, the power of tokenomics to advance funding for AGI’s next unicorns led by the Co-founder of @SingularityDAO, Mario Casiraghi @MAC_0_0, Web3's impact on venture capital led by the Founder of Primal Capital, Trent Barnes, and our the decentralized accelerator @DeepFunding led by our own Jan Horlings.

Decentralization strategies were also explored, including a fireside chat with Irfan Demirok and Trent Barnes from DigiCEX, the newly formed AI #Web3 CEX, and a presentation by Bill Inman on Sentience, the first decentralized AI wallet designed for personalized data.

The Summit also touched upon the role of robots and gaming in the Superintelligence revolution, with discussions on AI human hive minds with Logan Golema @futjr_ and David Lake from Sentience Inc., and game distribution in Web3 with Brendan Dunne, Founder of The Play Foundation. Bill Inman, then gave a presentation showcasing Dr. @DeepakChopra’s AI twin powered by @protocol_twin and exploring the potential of AI twins.

The Summit concluded with a Super Launch Party featuring Desdemona's Dream Band and the sensational pop star, Desi.

A special thank you to all the presenters, panelists, and attendees who helped make this Business Summit a resounding success. A special shoutout to our community member @silbererde for his unwavering support and continuous contributions!

RT @rabbitx_io: A Lens into RabbitX: Infrastructure, Diagnosing an Issue, and Shipping a Fix

We recently had a large trader complain of latency issues. Some market orders were executing with several-second delays. We opened an internal review.

Here's what we found, and how we fixed it:

THE PROBLEM

While overall volume has remained steady, we've seen occasional large bursts of orders being submitted in close succession. This sometimes exceeds over 6,000 requests/sec (we have some market makers and HFT funds who use rapid-fire algo trading, we're built for both retail and institutions).

We've seen volume spikes as high as 15k request/sec over the last month. These surges were creating sporadic bottlenecks, resulting in small delays.

THE DIAGNOSES

Our real-time risk engine checks account margin, open positions, and equity at the account and exchange lever after each order and withdrawal placed on RabbitX. We call this Real-Time Proof of Solvency (RTPOS).

Every order must be margin compliant at the account level, and RabbitX must be solvency compliant on the exchange level, or the order won't execute.

RabbitX grew substantially in unique trading addresses from the @BlastFutures expansion (March 2024). RTPOS means we simulate margin and solvency for every single trade, open order, and all open positions for both BFX and RBX now.

More traders, no matter how big or small, means more discrete checks happening. Which means more stress on our infrastructure.

With all of these increases, we only heard complaints from one user that some of his market orders were a little slow.

Pretty good. But not good enough.

THE FIX

Our RTPOS adheres to the ACID framework (atomicity, consistency, isolation, durability). This way, every transaction can be checked hypothetically and rejected in a single atomic operation if it violates account margin OR exchange solvency. This is the security and protection you get on RabbitX. Milady.

As the number of traders and orders grew, this check started to create latency issues. Security and risk are paramount to everything built on RabbitX. But our traders also demand nothing short of lightspeed execution.

Our high-performance matching engine is built using Tarantool, an in-memory database with an expressive programming language called Lua.

To address this latency issue when trading volume spikes, we brought on more computing resources and optimized how these checks are sequenced and performed to make sure we never fall below both our performance standards AND our risk standards.

We tested it, and released it. So far, so good. But if the issue pops up again, we'll be back in the lab to fix it.

Trade. Earn. Win. RabbitX.

Proud to be recognized as friendly

We believe that BUSL is a net positive for @LiquityProtocol

As said in their thread & article, 35 Liquity V1 forks were launched, and most of them were “wild” forks. In other words, they were deployed without prior communication with Liquity

The wild forks had a minimal will for collaboration, which ultimately penalized users

BUSL is a relevant way to promote the development of "friendly forks", which actively collaborate with the original protocol

RT @GlyphFinance: 1/2

Points? Nope… Glyph Marks!

Marks are the backbone of our reward system at Glyph Finance, incentivizing users to engage and contribute to our ecosystem. They represent your participation and activity within Glyph, rewarding you for utilizing our platform and contributing to its growth.

How to Earn Marks

Marks can be earned through various activities on our platform. Here’s the calculation of how you can accumulate Marks:

Points Per Asset Per Day = (amountSupplied * USDPrice * supplyMultiplier) + (amountBorrowed * USDPrice * borrowMultiplier)

Example 1: Glyphda lends 10 $FRAX per day, FRAX = 1$ so we multiply 10 * 1 = 10, on top of that he gets the 10x multiplier. To summarize = 10 * 1 * 10 = 10 Marks per day.

Example 2: Betsie lends 1 $frxETH per day and borrows 1k FRAX against it. Going from the example above if 1frxETH = $3.5k she would get 87.5k Marks per day for lending (1 * 3500 * 25 = 87.500) + 25k Marks per day for borrowing (1000 * 1 * 25 = 25k) = 112.5k Marks per day total.

wstETH cap on Symbiotic had been lifted, and majority of Mellow LRTs' TVL is now on Symbiotic, which also means Symbiotic Points are now in play on @pendle_fi.

With this, Intern decided to relook into the Mellow YTs but again, please understand that these numbers are derived from many, many assumptions, some of which you may or may not agree with.

Please take the time to go through the list 👇🏻

Assuming $500 capital:

• Estimated ROI = 279%-304%
• Estimated APY = 🚀🚀🚀

---------- 

Symbiotic Points

• Current points derived from current TVL data from @DefiLlama

• Daily Point Growth is based on the latest daily growth figure, with a 4x multiplier on top, which means it's 4 times larger than it is estimated to be currently (i.e. production based on ~$4B TVL vs. $1B TVL now)

• Default multiplier is 1x for Symbiotic. However, a discount is applied to <Pendle Multiplier> here, based on the ratio of Vault TVL in Symbiotic: Vault TVL not in Symbiotic at the respective VAULT CAP. In other words, <My Points> shown is lower than the current trajectory. 

• Assuming $10B FDV + 30 Sep snapshot + 5% airdrop

----------

@mellowprotocol Points

• Current points derived from TVL breakdown of all Mellow vaults

• Daily Point Growth is based on the latest daily growth figure, with a 10x multiplier on top, which means it's 10 times larger than it is estimated to be currently

• Similarly, Pendle Multiplier is based on the ratio of Vault TVL in Symbiotic: Vault TVL not in Symbiotic at the respective VAULT CAP (2x Mellow Points when Symbiotic points are active, 3x Mellow Points when Symbiotic point are NOT active)

• Assuming $750M FDV + 30 Sep snapshot + 5% airdrop

----------

Symbiotic Points

• Current points derived from TVL breakdown of all Mellow vaults

• Assuming $750M FDV + 30 Sep snapshot + 5% airdrop

Liquid Staking Derivatives (#LSD) are #DeFi’s latest superpower.

Spool's Smart Vault Tokens (SVT) offer the same punch but for yield-generating DeFi positions across dozens of blue-chip strategies. 

Let’s crack open the next big thing for your portfolio.

🎓 Quick Recap
LSDs are tokens issued by protocols like @LidoFinance in exchange for staking your crypto. 

Similarly, Deposit NFTs (dNFTs) are #NFT receipts of your Smart Vault deposits that can be burned for SVTs, representing your share of the Vault.

Both concepts provide liquidity and flexibility for locked assets.

🪄 The Magic of Liquidity
The true power of LSDs and SVTs comes from the liquidity they provide. They allow you to trade or use your staked assets despite them being locked up. 

Now, staking no longer means “idle funds” - instead, it means more yield in innovative ways.

📊 Diversification for Lower
Risk diversification is key for any investment portfolio.

Staking across multiple LSD protocols reduces risk, and SVTs take this concept to the next level by enabling investment in shares of diverse Smart Vaults, each earning their own yield across blue-chip DeFi protocols. 

This "diverse diversity" approach maximizes security and minimizes counterparty risk.

🚀 Yield Boosts
Similar to LSDs, SVTs could be used as yield-generating tokens in DeFi. Their yield-bearing nature means that protocols accepting SVTs receive a proportional share of the underlying vault's yield, helping optimize collateral and boost overall returns. 

It’s like exchanges staking their reserve assets, only more diverse and risk-controlled.

⚖️ Governance Enabled
One critical feature of LSDs is their pass-through governance capabilities. 

Without this feature, liquid staking could pose a serious centralization risk. 

Spool Smart Vaults allow for gated access and pass-through governance, ensuring maximum decentralization.

👀 SVTs: The Next Big Thing
Smart Vault Tokens are the logical next step from Liquid Staking Derivatives – and they're ready to use today. 

Whether you're an investor looking to optimize your yield strategies or a builder seeking to build innovative DeFi products, SVTs are a powerful tool.

Ready to unlock the potential of SVTs?

For individual investors:
Head over to https://t.co/RMWGaZqpqW to create your own vault in just minutes.

For enterprises and builders:
Visit https://t.co/Mgt7sKpWmt to start creating white-label products and solutions tailored to your unique needs.

With a capital of $1,000:

Estimated ROI = 135%
Estimated APY = 4196%
Days Held = 83 days

----------

@symbioticfi Points

• Current points derived from current TVL data from
@DefiLlama

• Daily Point Growth is based on the latest daily growth figure, with a 4x multiplier on top, which means it's 4 times larger than it is estimated to be currently (i.e. production based on ~$4B TVL vs. $1B TVL now)

• Default multiplier is 1x for Symbiotic. However, a discount is applied to <Pendle Multiplier> here, based on the ratio of pzETH Vault TVL in Symbiotic: Vault TVL not in Symbiotic at CAP. In other words, <My Points> shown is lower than the current trajectory. 

• Since it's McDonald's season as stated, we're assuming $6B FDV 🍟 + 30 Sep snapshot + 5% airdrop

----------

@mellowprotocol Points

• Current points derived from TVL breakdown of all Mellow vaults

• Daily Point Growth is based on the latest daily growth figure, with a 10x multiplier on top, which means it's 10 times larger than it is estimated to be currently

• Similarly, Pendle Multiplier is based on the ratio of pzETH Vault TVL in Symbiotic: Vault TVL not in Symbiotic at CAP (2x Mellow Points when Symbiotic points are active, 3x Mellow Points when Symbiotic point are NOT active)

• Assuming $500M FDV 🍟+ 30 Sep snapshot + 5% airdrop

----------

@RenzoProtocol ezPoints

• Daily Point Growth estimated based on current TVL, with a 1.5x multiplier on top

• This is only accounting for Season 2 which is ending this month. The value of points accrued after 31 July and subsequent seasons are NOT accounted for in this calculation.

• Assuming $500M FDV 🍟+ 31 July snapshot + 5% airdrop

Disclaimer: These are estimations which may or may not be accurate. These numbers should never ever be construed as financial advice. How much are points worth? Will the airdrops be enough to recover your YT costs? No one knows, we can only guess so NFA DYOR.

RT @WiseLending: Multiple concerned citizens have inquired about the Jan 12 attack that occurred on the V1 of our protocol, so allow us to set some minds at ease. 

We spent the last 3 years building a new hyper-capital-efficient lend/borrow protocol from the ground up (we are not an Aave fork). New protocols must be battle tested, so last October, after we got the first report back from Omniscia (our first auditor), we decided to deploy our contracts and put about 10% of our DAO funds (100 ETH) on our platform, saving the great majority of our funds until we had been battle tested sufficiently.

Although our code is very high quality, Wise Lending V1 did get wiped out (Oct 2023) by an "empty pool" attack that manipulated a rounding discrepancy (I say discrepancy not error because it was more a weakness of the Solidity language with reference to decimals than a coding error). 

Nevertheless, we lost the 100 ETH plus a little more that was contributed by 2 or 3 close community members that were helping us test the UI. We took the hit and paid our community members back from the DAO. We also patched the protocol to always round shares against users in favor of the protocol.

Omniscia took no responsibility for the missed critical, saying that the report they sent was only a "preliminary report". We scratched our head at that, but then asked when the final report would be done on the now patched codebase, since we had already paid in full up-front (they demanded that at the start). They tried to charge us full price for another audit, but this did not make any sense if they in fact had only given us a preliminary report. After dragging their feet for a month they finally agreed to finish.

So they gave us their finished report (which looks 95% like the "preliminary report") and gave the ok that our patch was good, once again giving us a false sense of security.

So then we put another 100 ETH on our platform after re-deploying our contracts, and immediately got wiped out again on Jan 12th. As it turns out, rounding against the users is not enough if there is nobody else participating in the pool. The "extra" shares still go in favor of the attacker if he is the only one who deposited in that pool. This was an even more complicated attack that was essentially the opposite side of the coin from the first attack...super frustrating. @danielvf wrote the best post-mortem of this attack and was in awe of its complexity. https://t.co/HMbjH9eMe1

So once again our DAO took a hit, and we paid back the handful of community testers who also had funds deposited on Jan 12. 

At this point we were pretty fed up with our auditors and decided to spend several precious months on two back-to-back competitive audits with massive ($160k and $200k) prize pools. We went with @HatsFinance and @code4rena and were very pleased with the results from each firm, although the lost time was killer.

Both firms turned up useful finds (nothing critical) and after patching up the useful finds, we re-deployed our V2 on Arbitrum and Ethereum which brings us to today. We have also protected our protocol even further with live scanning methods (we won't mention the provider for OPSEC reasons).

We think that the response to the attack should match the effect of the issue, and this is why we handled everything on Discord (some of our community members don't even have a twitter account) rather than posting a formal response on Twitter on this account. This was a relatively small amount of funds that did not effect very many people, and all were made whole immediately after the event. 

Our founder was also pretty vocal during this time about us being hacked and the massive competitive audits we opted for afterwards: https://t.co/o2IrMvVat1

We are still not sure if our overall response was appropriate, or if we should have done more on this Twitter account specifically, but we hope this clears things up now. It was frustrating for us to get a black stain on our reputation after 3 years of hard work for an attack that we planned for in a battle testing phase, and mitigated accordingly ahead of time because we KNEW it was a possibility. 

We hope that anyone paying attention recognizes our commitment to safety and security, as well as the fact that we handled the security aspect of this just about as well as anyone could ask for. 

Thank you for supporting us.❤️

Our founder was also pretty vocal during this time about us being hacked and the massive competitive audits we opted for afterwards: https://t.co/o2IrMvVat1

We are still not sure if our overall response was appropriate, or if we should have done more on this Twitter account specifically, but we hope this clears things up now. It was frustrating for us to get a black stain on our reputation after 3 years of hard work for an attack that we planned for in a battle testing phase, and mitigated accordingly ahead of time because we KNEW it was a possibility. 

We hope that anyone paying attention recognizes our commitment to safety and security, as well as the fact that we handled the security aspect of this just about as well as anyone could ask for. 

Thank you for supporting us.❤️

RT @BackTheBunny: Wartime Fiscal Rules, Stablecoins, and Treasury Bonds: A Ritual DeFi Should Avoid

DeFi shouldn't want our stables collateralized with Treasurys. Did you know the US can strategically default on specific bonds or freeze them? Treasurys should be avoided, not embraced, as we evolve. It leaves us at the mercy of one of our biggest adversaries in the struggle for control of the financial system.

Also...

This is not a bull case for stablecoins thinking the US "needs" us, because the US doesn't need to sell bonds if things get bad.

US treasuries are a vestigial ritual from pre 1971. The system changed, and no one updated their priors. Academics and "experts" everywhere still preaching fixed-exchange rate economics in a floating-rate world.

They could just say "fuck it".

They are unnecessary.

Treasurys are an anachronism of the gold standard. The US doesn't need to "raise" money anymore, and by that I mean taking reserves out of the system (selling bonds) and then putting them back in (fiscal spending)...

All so the raw amount of dollars in the onshore system stays the same. All so it can maintain a peg to gold. There is no more peg. There is no more need for this. There is no more fixed-exchange rate.

That's the only reason USTs exist: they are a ritual to keep a gold peg that died long ago.

Thinking stablecoins will curry US favor because it's a sinkhole for debt and they need us... exists in a world where the rules are actually the rules.

People say they know the US can print money. This is a correct verbal understanding.

But then they'll go talk about "bankruptcy" or "how will the government raise money, who will buy our bonds?" or "This is a bull case for stablecoins". Demonstrating zero embodied understanding.

Do you really, really know what being able to print means? Because it does not mean the government needs to say "please finance us by selling us dollars we can make at will."

People will say they get the soft currency thing, then in the next breath demonstrate they have not internalized what that means at all.

WARTIME FISCAL POLICY: THERE ARE NO RULES

> "But the TGA must be funded before it can spend."

The US breaks the rules as expedient right? Right. Because they're the ones who make up the rules, so they can just change them right? Right. 

There's an actual clause in the Fed charter called Section 13(3) Unusual and Exigent Circumstances that says basically this, "We will break the rules as emergencies dictate. Who defines emergencies? Government".

Ok, so let's create a fictitious scenario: there's zero bid for USTs. No one wants our bonds. The TGA can't be "funded" per the normal rules. We're insolvent now! 

You think the US will go.... "well I guess that's that, we're bankrupt so no more government or spending"?

I assure you if this were to happen the TGA can and will.... just have a negative number in front of it. The Fed/Primary Dealers could play games to get around it too (I have broken this down elsewhere). Or the Treasury can just.... spend. Even without raising anything.

You know why? Because the rules of Treasurys and the TGA are COMPLETELY MADE UP. MADE-UP RULES CAN BE REMADE AS CONVENIENT.

Do you remember TARP? Do you remember Covid? Do you not recall how quickly rules are changed in "emergencies"?

If you don't think this is possible, you're saying you think it's beyond the pale for a government and politicians who break their own rules all the time to.... let a number in an account have a negative symbol in front of it.

You think they draw the line at the TGA having a negative symbol in the account. If you use words like "bankruptcy" or think the USG really needs people to buy bonds lest they go under, that is in effect what you are saying. I hope this very raw, candid framing elucidates to you that this simply is not so.

It'll happen. There will be a couple weeks of fake outrage, and then everyone will just go back to normal. Because that's what you did the last time they broke their own rules.

Recall the Patriot Act? Suspending all your rights in 2020 and locking you inside? Yeah, if you didn't revolt over that, you're sure as hell not going to stop a negative symbol in a government account.

Actions have consequences, especially #DeFi.

Spool Vaults offer a range of customizable features called Actions. These Actions are tied to user activity, like deposits and withdrawals, and enable unique experiences for vault creators and investors.

Let’s dive into how you can make Actions work for you, your products, and your portfolio!

💵 Pay to Play
Smart Vaults can be configured with an initial fee during creation, allowing vault creators to secure an immediate return on investment.

Creators can pocket the entry fee or use it to create a flywheel of rewards, enhancing their Vault’s adoption and social value.

📜 Insured Deposits
Spool only interfaces with secure blue-chip protocols, but DeFi is still young and intrinsically risky.

Vault creators can set an insurance fee, charged when investors deposit their funds into the vault, to help mitigate potential risks.

Insurance means assurance, helping edify your Vaults in the eyes of investors.

🧠 Smart Swaps
Easily compound investments in your Vault with automatic swaps.

As the name suggests, this feature automatically swaps deposits into the correct tokens required for your Vault’s strategies.

By streamlining the investment process, investors save time and money and can immediately deposit into your Vault the moment they decide to invest.

⌚ Time Locks and Withdrawals
Spool Vaults allow for "time locks," which prevent investors from withdrawing early.

If that sounds a bit too limiting, Vault creators can opt to enforce withdrawal penalties instead of strict time locks.

This flexibility of incentives and disincentives aligns investor behavior with the Vault creator’s long-term objectives and the health of the Vault.

🔒 Immutability of Actions
Once an Action is set for a Smart Vault, it can’t be changed after the Vault goes live!

This immutability means clarity for investors, prevents conflicting Vault requirements, and creates a "set and forget" situation that benefits everyone.

🧩 Customizable Yield = Future of DeFi
Actions allow you to create yield-bearing Vaults and white-labeled DeFi yield products tailored to your specific wants, needs, clients, and offerings.

The possibilities are nearly endless, giving you full control over your yield-generation strategies.

Ready to get started?

To create your own vault in minutes, head to https://t.co/RMWGaZpRBo and get started now!

With Spool Vaults and customizable Actions, yield-generating DeFi strategies are at your fingertips.

Liquity v2: The only venue where YOU can borrow on your own terms
​
Tired of dancing to someone else's tune?
​
For too long, DeFi borrowing rates have been dictated by:

• Governance decisions
• Complex algorithms
• One-size-fits-all fees
​
But what if YOU could choose your own rates? 👀
​
Enter Liquity v2 - the only venue where everyone can pay the rate they want.

Here's why this is a big deal 👇

Limitations of Current Borrowing Models
​
Money Markets (e.g., Compound, Aave, Llama Lend) use pre-set utilization ratios to determine rates, which can be volatile and disconnected from actual market conditions. Borrowers are not in control over sudden rate changes, leading to uncertainty and higher costs.

High utilization of assets can also trap lenders (where they cannot withdraw funds), causing liquidity crises like the recent incident on Llama Lend.

How about governance-based CDPs? 👇
​
Governance-based CDPs (e.g., MakerDAO) rely on governance decisions to set rates, making them slow to react to market changes.
​
As these rate changes are always lagging (weeks, if not months), they are also susceptible to governance politics and misaligned incentives. Moreover,  these venues often include risky collateral types (including centralized assets) adding another layer of risk for the borrower.

The Fixed-Fee CDP Model (e.g., Liquity v1) also has its' own issues where a one-time origination fee struggles to adapt to changing market conditions. This can cause the borrowing experience to be less than ideal.
​
All these models leave little room for true rate discovery and borrower autonomy as everyone has to pay the same rate.
​
👇
​
Enter the magic pill 💊: allowing users to set their own rates
​
To date, there's been no way to determine the benchmark DeFi market interest rate.  Liquity v2 changes this by being completely market driven, allowing truer rates to be created through free market forces.
​
This capitalistic approach can both create and complement a de-facto reference rate for borrowing within DeFi.
​
For the first time ever, users will have full control and flexibility over their rates, and not everyone will play the same rate!
​
👇
​
The reference rate for DeFi
​
By allowing users to set their own rates, Liquity v2 will help provide:
​
• True market formation: Interest rates will reflect real market driven supply and demand.

 • Control: Users can now set rates based on their market expectations, not arbitrary algorithms. 

• Flexibility: Users can adjust their rates as conditions change, avoiding liquidity crunches.
​
Liquity v2’s innovation extends beyond borrowers. Other DeFi protocols can reference its market-driven rates, fostering a more cohesive ecosystem where rates are set by actual market participants rather than arbitrary methods.
​
The Liquity team will be at @stable_summit and @ETHCC, and we'd love to catch up!
​
Whether you’re a passionate DeFi enthusiast, an ecosystem builder, or interested in v2, feel free to get in touch with us through our DMs 🙏
​

RT @70k3m3ch: The launch of Autopilot is looming on the horizon. Being technically complex and offering massive value to different groups, each benefitting in their own way, it can initially be difficult to wrap one’s head around.
Starting with LPs I will try to explain in a straightforward and tangible way, minimizing technical details and big-picture concepts, why you should be excited about it too.

Providing liquidity to stable pools is for many reasons a well established and popular way to earn yield. While some LPs certainly try to keep up with new opportunities by checking yields and switching pools from time to time, which is already time intensive and cost prohibitive to most, I will posit that nobody ever attempts to fully optimize their LP positions in an ongoing manner. Many interconnected factors beyond the advertised APR make this an unsolvable problem for an individual, and the cost would only be stomachable by the very, very few.

Autopilot unlocks a new way to LP by autonomously monitoring and assessing on-chain data to rebalance and auto-compound into the most advantageous LP positions.
Only a single gas-optimized deposit into an Autopool, each of which includes a predefined option set of assets, DEXs and pools, is needed to start using Autopilot.
This transforms unprecedented and sophisticated LP optimization into a simple, user-friendly earn-type product. To round things off, the Autopools are built on the highly composable ERC-4626 standard, and the receipt token can be seamlessly integrated across DeFi.

At launch, Autopilot will focus on ETH-denominated Autopools for LSTs and LRTs. Beyond ETH, the plan is to quickly expand to other asset classes, such as stablecoins. Additionally, there are many exciting developments in the future, such as permissionless creation of Autopools.

This is only a bare bones overview, but I hope this will give you a good starting point to dive into more complex concepts and technical details that will come across your feed.

New updates proposed to Spark's MetaMorpho Vault and SparkLend ⚡️

A new @MakerDAO Executive Vote is live, containing a Spark Proxy Spell. If the vote passes, the following changes to Spark’s MetaMorpho Vault and SparkLend will be deployed.

Update Spark’s MetaMorpho Vault Supply Caps - Ethereum Mainnet

The following changes will be made to Spark’s MetaMorpho DAI Vault parameters:

• Increase the sUSDe 91.5% LLTV pool supply cap to 200 million DAI.

• Increase the sUSDe 86% LLTV pool supply cap to 500 million DAI.

These changes respond to a recent surge in user demand for sUSDe collateral pools and aim to align the capacities of sUSDe pools with their USDe counterparts.

Onboard USDC.e as Borrowable Asset - Gnosis Chain

Gnosis Chain has introduced a new USDC token, USDC.e. In the coming months, all USDC activity on the chain is expected to migrate to this new version. This proposal aims to ensure continued access to Gnosis Chain's USDC liquidity.

Initial parameters include:

• Optimal Utilization: 95%
• Supply Cap: 10 million USDC.e
• Borrow Cap: 8 million USDC.e

For the full list of parameters please review the proposal details: https://t.co/dOsku1DqBv

Update USDC Parameters to Prepare for Offboarding - Gnosis Chain

As users transition to the new USDC.e token, the older USDC version on Gnosis Chain will likely experience reduced support and decreased on-chain liquidity.

To manage this change and prepare for offboarding, the parameters of the USDC interest rate model will be updated as follows:

• Decrease Optimal Utilization to 80%
• Increase Slope2 to 50%
• Decrease Borrow Cap to 1 million USDC

A new Executive Vote is live on the Maker Governance portal.

🗳️ https://t.co/d4O69fvubn

MKR holders and delegates can use their voting power to deploy the changes listed below if they support them.

If this executive proposal passes, the following actions will occur within the Maker Protocol:

🔥 Smart Burn Engine (SBE) Parameters Update

Based on the latest analysis by BA Labs, the following SBE parameters will be updated:

• Decrease the hop parameter to 10,249 seconds.

• Decrease the bump parameter to 65,000 DAI.

⚡ Spark Proxy Spell

A Spark proxy spell at 0xc96420Dbe9568e2a65DD57daAD069FDEd37265fa will be triggered. This spell includes the following changes to Spark’s Metamorpho Vault and SparkLend:

[Mainnet] Update Spark's MetaMorpho Vault Supply Caps

The following changes will be made to the Spark's MetaMorpho DAI Vault parameters:

• Increase the sUSDe 91.5% LLTV pool supply cap to 200 million DAI.

• Increase the sUSDe 86% LLTV pool supply cap to 500 million DAI.

These updates aim to increase the capacity of sUSDe pools to match their USDe counterparts.

[Gnosis] Onboard USDC.e as Borrowable Asset

Gnosis Chain has introduced USDC.e, a new USDC token that complies with Circle’s standards. Over the next few months, all USDC activity on the chain will transition to this version.

To maintain access to USDC liquidity on Gnosis Chain, the USDC.e token will be onboarded to SparkLend. Initial parameters include:

• Optimal Utilization: 95%
• Supply Cap: 10 million USDC.e
• Borrow Cap: 8 million USDC.e

For the complete list of parameters, visit the Executive Vote link at the beginning of this post.

[Gnosis] Update USDC Parameters to Prepare for Offboarding

With the transition to USDC.e causing a decline in on-chain liquidity for the old version of USDC on Gnosis Chain, the following updates will be made to the Circle USDC (USDC) interest rate model to prepare for offboarding:

• Decrease Optimal Utilization to 80%
• Increase Slope2 to 50%
• Decrease Borrow Cap to 1 million USDC

💰 Launch Project Funding

The following transfers will be made to the Launch Project:

• Transfer 4,500,000 DAI to 0x3C5142F28567E6a0F172fd0BaaF1f2847f49D02F.

• Transfer 1,300 MKR to 0x3C5142F28567E6a0F172fd0BaaF1f2847f49D02F.

RT @LiquityProtocol: Liquity v2: The only venue where YOU can borrow on your own terms
​
Tired of dancing to someone else's tune?
​
For too long, DeFi borrowing rates have been dictated by:

• Governance decisions
• Complex algorithms
• One-size-fits-all fees
​
But what if YOU could choose your own rates? 👀
​
Enter Liquity v2 - the only venue where everyone can pay the rate they want.

Here's why this is a big deal 👇

Limitations of Current Borrowing Models
​
Money Markets (e.g., Compound, Aave, Llama Lend) use pre-set utilization ratios to determine rates, which can be volatile and disconnected from actual market conditions. Borrowers are not in control over sudden rate changes, leading to uncertainty and higher costs.

High utilization of assets can also trap lenders (where they cannot withdraw funds), causing liquidity crises like the recent incident on Llama Lend.

How about governance-based CDPs? 👇
​
Governance-based CDPs (e.g., MakerDAO) rely on governance decisions to set rates, making them slow to react to market changes.
​
As these rate changes are always lagging (weeks, if not months), they are also susceptible to governance politics and misaligned incentives. Moreover,  these venues often include risky collateral types (including centralized assets) adding another layer of risk for the borrower.

The Fixed-Fee CDP Model (e.g., Liquity v1) also has its' own issues where a one-time origination fee struggles to adapt to changing market conditions. This can cause the borrowing experience to be less than ideal.
​
All these models leave little room for true rate discovery and borrower autonomy as everyone has to pay the same rate.
​
👇
​
Enter the magic pill 💊: allowing users to set their own rates
​
To date, there's been no way to determine the benchmark DeFi market interest rate.  Liquity v2 changes this by being completely market driven, allowing truer rates to be created through free market forces.
​
This capitalistic approach can both create and complement a de-facto reference rate for borrowing within DeFi.
​
For the first time ever, users will have full control and flexibility over their rates, and not everyone will play the same rate!
​
👇
​
The reference rate for DeFi
​
By allowing users to set their own rates, Liquity v2 will help provide:
​
• True market formation: Interest rates will reflect real market driven supply and demand.

 • Control: Users can now set rates based on their market expectations, not arbitrary algorithms. 

• Flexibility: Users can adjust their rates as conditions change, avoiding liquidity crunches.
​
Liquity v2’s innovation extends beyond borrowers. Other DeFi protocols can reference its market-driven rates, fostering a more cohesive ecosystem where rates are set by actual market participants rather than arbitrary methods.
​
The Liquity team will be at @stable_summit and @ETHCC, and we'd love to catch up!
​
Whether you’re a passionate DeFi enthusiast, an ecosystem builder, or interested in v2, feel free to get in touch with us through our DMs 🙏
​
